title: Trump Speech Drinking Game: Rules For Playing While Watching The 2017 Joint Address To Congress
text:
02/28/17 AT 7:50 PM Close 
Newly sworn-in President Donald Trump was scheduled to give a non-State of the Union State of the Union address before Congress Tuesday, and even if you have better plans, you're probably watching it. In this age when @realDonaldTrump tweets every morning and "Saturday Night Live" roasts the White House every weekend, it's easy to get have political #FOMO. 
That brings us to tonight. If you're going to spend your hard-earned free time watching a live stream from Capitol Hill, you'd better enjoy it. So while Trump talks about "the renewal of the American spirit," as Press Secretary Sean Spicer described it, why not bring out some spirits of your own? 
Yes, we're talking about alcohol, and, yes, we're talking about a drinking game. 
We'll keep it simple â€” just grab your friends, crack open a domestic drink and follow these rules, with suggestions from the Root , Culturess and Debate Drinking . Whether you're a Democrat, Republican or neither, be responsible (and vote whenever you have the chance). 
Sip your drink if/when... 
... Trump mentions his win last November over Democrat Hillary Clinton 
... Trump runs down his accomplishments in office thus far 
... the camera shows First Lady Melania Trump 
... you spot a lawmaker shaking his or her head (or nodding enthusiastically) 
... Trump references fake news, reporters who aren't "fair" or the "failing" New York Times 
... Trump repeats his campaign slogan, "Make America Great Again" 
... he says the words "immigration," "jobs" or "future" 
Gulp if/when...
